availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Washington Jernigan (Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married Mary A. Gilbert Jernigan on February 6, 1845. Father of Tiberius H. Jernigan, Ann E. Jernigan, and Nancy E. Jernigan. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1850.

bibl.p:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Sub Division 2, p. 255; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Sub Division 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 43; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Paradise, Precinct 4, p. 18; Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Robertson County, 1845, Microfilm, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville; Find A Grave, "David Washington Jernigan (1819-1895)," Memorial #32464689, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi/page/gr/
http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=32464689 (accessed May 29, 2017).
